Response 1.Roydon: I can't believe how terrible my trip to Thailand was. Everything went wrong.
Response 1.Dory: Oh no, what happened? Did you miss your flight?

Response 2.Roydon: No, it was worse than that. The hotel lost my reservation and I had to sleep on the streets.
Response 2.Dory: That sounds awful. Did you at least get to see some sights during the day?

Response 3.Roydon: I tried to, but everywhere I went, I just kept getting ripped off by the locals.
Response 3.Dory: That must have been frustrating. Did you try any of the street food at least?

Response 4.Roydon: I did, but I got food poisoning and spent the rest of the trip in the hospital.
Response 4.Dory: That's terrible luck. Did you manage to salvage any part of the trip at all?

Response 5.Roydon: Not really. I was so angry the whole time, I couldn't enjoy anything.
Response 5.Dory: I'm sorry to hear that, Roydon. Maybe you can plan a better trip next time.

Response 6.Roydon: I don't think I ever want to travel again. It's just not worth the hassle.
Response 6.Dory: I understand how you feel, but don't let one bad experience ruin it for you forever.

Response 7.Roydon: Easy for you to say. You weren't the one stuck in a foreign country with nothing going right.
Response 7.Dory: I know, but sometimes these things happen. You just have to try and make the best of it.

Response 8.Roydon: I'll try to remember that for next time, but right now, I just need to vent about how awful it was.
Response 8.Dory: Vent all you need to, Roydon. I'm here to listen and support you through it all.

Response 9.Roydon: Thanks, Dory. I appreciate you being there for me, even when I'm at my angriest.
